Ecclesiasticus *__10.1: A wise judge shall <u>judge his people</u>, and the government of a prudent man shall be steady.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.2: As the judge of the people is himself, so also are his ministers: and what manner of man the ruler of a city is, such also are they that dwell therein.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.3: An unwise king shall be the ruin of his people: and cities shall be inhabited through the prudence of the rulers.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.4: The power of the earth is in the hand of God, and in his time he will raise up a profitable ruler over it.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.5: The prosperity of man is in the hand of God, and upon the person of <u>the scribe</u> he shall lay his honour.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.6: Remember not any injury done thee by thy neighbour, and do thou nothing by deeds of injury.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.7: Pride is hateful before God and men: and all iniquity of nations is execrable.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.8: A kingdom is translated from one people to another, because of injustices, and wrongs, and injuries, and divers deceits.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.9: But nothing is more wicked than the covetous man. Why is earth and ashes proud?
Ecclesiasticus *__10.10: There is not a more wicked thing than to love money: for such a one setteth even his own soul to sale: because while he liveth he hath cast away his bowels.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.11: All power is of short life. A long sickness is troublesome to the physician.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.12: The physician cutteth off a short sickness: so also a king is today, and tomorrow he shall die.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.13: For when a man shall die, he shall inherit serpents, and beasts, and worms.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.14: The beginning of the pride of man, is to fall off from God:
Ecclesiasticus *__10.15: Because his heart is departed from him that made him: for pride is the beginning of all sin: he that holdeth it, shall be filled with maledictions, and it shall ruin him in the end.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.16: Therefore hath the Lord disgraced the assemblies of the wicked, and hath utterly destroyed them.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.17: God hath overturned the thrones of proud princes, and hath set up the meek in their stead.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.18: God hath made the roots of proud nations to wither, and hath planted the humble of these nations.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.19: The Lord hath overthrown the lands of the Gentiles, and hath destroyed them even to the foundation.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.20: He hath made some of them to wither away, and hath destroyed them, and hath made the memory of them to cease from the earth.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.21: God hath abolished the memory of the proud, and hath preserved the memory of them that are humble in mind.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.22: Pride was not made for men: nor wrath for the race of women.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.23: That seed of men shall be honoured, which feareth God: but that seed shall be dishonoured, which transgresseth the commandments of the Lord.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.24: In the midst of brethren their chief is honourable: so shall they that fear the Lord, be in his eyes.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.25: The fear of God is the glory of the rich, and of the honourable, and of the poor:
Ecclesiasticus *__10.26: Despise not a just man that is poor, and do not magnify a sinful man that is rich.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.27: The great man, and the judge, and the mighty is in honour: and there is none greater than he that feareth God.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.28: They that are free shall serve a servant that is wise: and a man that is prudent and well instructed will not murmur when he is reproved; and he that is ignorant, shall not be honoured.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.29: Extol not thyself in doing thy work, and linger not in the time of distress:
Ecclesiasticus *__10.30: Better is he that laboureth, and aboundeth in all things, than he that boasteth himself and wanteth bread.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.31: My son, keep thy soul in meekness, and give it honour according to its desert.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.32: Who will justify him that sinneth against his own soul? and who will honour him that dishonoureth his own soul?
Ecclesiasticus *__10.33: The poor man is glorified by his discipline and fear: and there is a man that is honoured for his wealth.
Ecclesiasticus *__10.34: But he that is glorified in poverty, how much more in wealth? and he that is glorified in wealth, let him fear poverty.
